Detailed Description

Common interface for all calibration objects.

It is used to work with real world units. It provides only two simple operations: distance computation and local transformation.

Definition at line 27 of file ITransformation2d.h.

Member Enumeration Documentation

enum i2d::ITransformation2d::ExactnessMode

Enumerator:
EM_NONE  There is no preferencies, should be automatically selected.
EM_EXACT  Only precise calculation should be done.
EM_VISUAL  Only visual similarity of transformation is important.
EM_ANY  There is only important, that some result will be outputted.

Definition at line 32 of file ITransformation2d.h.

enum i2d::ITransformation2d::TransformationFlags

Enumerator:
TF_FORWARD  There are some arguments (inputs) where the transformation function is defined.
TF_INVERTED  There are some outputs where the inverted transformation is defined.
TF_INJECTIVE  Function in injective, it means for each input values the output value is defined.
TF_SURJECTIVE  Function in surjective, it means there is at least one input value for each outputs.
TF_PRESERVE_NULL  This transformation preserve position [0, 0].
TF_PRESERVE_DISTANCE  This transformation preserve distance.
TF_PRESERVE_ANGLE  This transformation preserve angles.
TF_AFFINE  This is affine transformation.
TF_CONTINUES  This transformation is represented by continues function.

Definition at line 52 of file ITransformation2d.h.

Member Function Documentation

virtual const ITransformation2d* i2d::ITransformation2d::CreateCombinedTransformation ( const ITransformation2d &  transform  )  const [pure virtual]

Create new transformation being combination of this transformation and the second one.

Please note, that created object is owned by the caller and the caller must remove them.

Returns:
new transformation object (owned by the caller) or NULL if creatiion was not possible.

Implemented in i2d::CAffineTransformation2d.

const CVector2d &  origPos2,

ExactnessMode  mode = EM_NONE 
) const [pure virtual]

Compute a shorteness distance in transformed coordinations.

Parameters:
origPos1 first position in original coordinates.
origPos2 second position in original coordinates.
result object where result distance between positions in transformed coordinates will be stored.
mode controls needed transformation exactness.
Returns:
true, if calculation done correctly.
